definition: to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
